newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Cambodia assures Malaysia investments are safe-Anw.
newsitem.headline: Cambodia assures Malaysia investments are safe-Anw.

text.p: Cambodia has assured Malaysia its investments in strife-torn Cambodia are safe, Acting Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said on Friday.
"I do not see any immediate or long-term difficulty for our investment in Cambodia," Anwar said in a speech at a ground breaking ceremony for FACB Bhd'S new corporate headquarters building.
Malaysia, with nearly $3.0 billion committed to various projects, is the largest foreign investor in Cambodia.

FACB president and chief executive Chen Lip Keong has a $1.3 billion project to develop an airport and casino resort in Cambodia's southern city of Sihanoukville. Anwar said the Cambodian government has given Malaysia its categorical assurance that it would continue to support foreign investment.
Second Prime Minister Hun Sen ousted first Prime Minister Norodom Ranariddh in a bloody coup earlier this month.
The violence over the last two weeks has left many investors uncertain about the future of their projects.
